The images circulating on social media s: The Simpsons" predicting the death of George Floyd were proven to be false. The expert's verdict states that these images do not show a "prediction" made by "The Simpsons" in the 1990s.
The image showing Chief Wiggum kneeling: s neck, reminiscent of George Floyd's death, while Lisa Simpson stands by holding a "Justice for George" sign was created by Instagram user Yuri Pomo. This image was not part of an actual episode of "The Simpsons" and was posted on Pomo's Instagram account five days after Floyd's death.
The expert: s verdict highlights the intention behind Pomo's artwork, stating that Pomo aimed to use their drawings to bring something good and useful in the right way when the situation requires it. The expert emphasizes that Pomo's image was not an actual prediction made by "The Simpsons."
The collage of images also implies that: The Simpsons" predicted a police station being set on fire. However, the expert's verdict clarifies that the photograph included in the collage does not depict a police station fire. Instead, it shows an unfinished housing complex near the Third Precinct in Minneapolis, which was burning on May 27, 2020.
